config_description: The amount of time unacknowledged data is allowed on a streaming connection. The default is 5 minutes. Increase it or set it to 0 in order to increase the timeout.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration option 'internode_streaming_tcp_user_timeout_in_ms' is used to set the amount of time unacknowledged data is allowed on a streaming connection. The code checks the latency of processing incoming stream messages against this timeout value and logs a warning if the processing time exceeds the configured timeout.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever an incoming stream message is received and processed. The frequency of triggering depends on the rate of incoming stream messages in the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'internode_streaming_tcp_user_timeout_in_ms' configuration option is on the reliability and performance of streaming connections in the system. Setting a higher timeout value can prevent premature closure of streaming connections due to processing delays, while setting it too low may result in connections being closed before data transfer is complete.
